page.title: 07Mr. Morrell's Day.
page.content: A typical day for the vicar starts at 9 a.m. when he prepares for the weekly school assembly. This is followed by prayers for 30 mins. From 10 a.m. to 10.45 is Holy Commumnion. Straight afterwards he has school assembly and then he teaches the 4th year of Shedfield School where he is also Chairman of the School Governors. At noon he stays in his office until about 1 p.m. when he has lunch. After this he has meetings and travels around in his car to visit different people. Then from 5 to 5.30 p.m. he has prayers in Church. After this he spends an hour with his family. Before going to bed he visits children who are going to be baptised. His happy moments are at weddings and baptisms and his sad moments are at funerals, especially when children are involved.
